item.title: Hello World
item.description: I’ve been procrastinating setting up a real blog for… well, years. Now it’s here. Read on for the why and the how.

item.title: About
item.description: What is This? I was inspired by an article on Management README’s and thought it was high time I do something similar. This is mostly for folks I work with, but it also sheds some light on me personally. About Me My name is Greg Herlein. I am an Engineering Leader and Maker based in San Francisco California. I am active on LinkedIn and sometimes on Twitter. I keep my open source work on Github.

item.title: About
item.description: Projects This is a short list of projects I am currently working on (or have built and am actively using): GoNetMon - Network use visualization writting in GoLang, using Prometheus and Kibana ouilookup - CLI tool written in go to look up the vendor for a given MAC address PiBlaster-MQTT - port of PiBlaster to use MQTT instead of a local charachter device goxb_mqtt - native go code that reads from an XBox™ controller (using libusb) and sends events over MQTT
